SEARCH
Package dev.zpo.controller

Class SubjectController

java.lang.Object
dev.zpo.controller.SubjectController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/subjects") @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:3000") public class SubjectController extends Object
RESTful API Controller for managing subjects. This controller provides endpoints for adding, deleting, and retrieving subject information, as well as retrieving subjects with grades for a student and average grades for subjects.

Endpoints:

  • GET /api/subjects/get: Get all subjects
  • GET /api/subjects/{subjectId}: Get a subject by ID
  • POST /api/subjects/add: Add a new subject
  • DELETE /api/subjects/{subjectId}: Delete a subject by ID
  • GET /api/subjects/sbj/{studentId}: Get subjects with grades for a student
  • GET /api/subjects/average-grades: Get subjects with average grades

This controller handles HTTP requests related to subjects and delegates the processing to the SubjectService. It follows REST principles to map HTTP methods and URIs to corresponding service methods.

Since:
2024-02-08
Version:
1.0
Author:
Ronald Frangulyan

  • Method Details

    • getAllSubjects

      @GetMapping("/get") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Subject>> getAllSubjects()
      Get all subjects.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing a list of all subjects and HTTP status code 200 (OK).

    • getSubjectBySubjectId

      @GetMapping("/{subjectId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Subject> getSubjectBySubjectId(@PathVariable Long subjectId)
      Get a subject by ID.
      Parameters:
      subjectId - The ID of the subject to retrieve.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the requested subject and HTTP status code 200 (OK) if found, or an HTTP status code indicating failure.

    • addSubject

      @PostMapping("/add") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Subject> addSubject(@RequestBody Subject subject)
      Add a new subject.
      Parameters:
      subject - The subject object to be added.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the added subject and HTTP status code 201 (Created) if successful, or an HTTP status code indicating failure.

    • deleteSubjectBySubjectId

      @DeleteMapping("/{subjectId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteSubjectBySubjectId(@PathVariable Long subjectId)
      Delete a subject by ID.
      Parameters:
      subjectId - The ID of the subject to be deleted.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with HTTP status code 204 (No Content) if successful, or an HTTP status code indicating failure.

    • getSubjectsAndGradesForStudent

      @GetMapping("/sbj/{studentId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Object[]>> getSubjectsAndGradesForStudent(@PathVariable Long studentId)
      Get subjects with grades for a student.
      Parameters:
      studentId - The ID of the student to retrieve subjects and grades for.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing a list of objects representing subjects and grades, along with HTTP status code 200 (OK).

    • getSubjectsAndAverageGrades

      @GetMapping("/average-grades") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Object[]>> getSubjectsAndAverageGrades()
      Get subjects with average grades.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing a list of objects representing subjects and average grades, along with HTTP status code 200 (OK).
